attributes.review:
Somebody once told me the world is gonna roll me
I ain't the sharpest tool in the shed
She was looking kind of dumb with her finger and her thumb
In the shape of an "L" on her forehead
Well, the years start coming and they don't stop coming
Fed to the rules and I hit the ground running
Didn't make sense not to live for fun
Your brain gets smart but your head gets dumb
So much to do, so much to see
So what's wrong with taking the backstreets?
You'll never know if you don't go
You'll never shine if you don't glow
Hey now, you're an all star
Get your game on, go play
Hey now, you're a rock star
Get the show on, get paid
And all that glitters is gold
Only shooting stars break the mold
It's a cool place, and they say it gets colder
You're bundled up now, wait 'til you get older
But the meteor men beg to differ
Judging by the hole in the satellite picture
The ice we skate is getting pretty thin
The water's getting warm so you might as well swim
My world's on fire, how 'bout yours?
That's the way I like it and I'll never get bored
Hey now, you're an all star
Get your game on, go play
Hey now, you're a rock star
Get the show on, get paid
All that glitters is gold
Only shooting stars break the mold
Somebody once asked
Could I spare some change for gas?
"I need to get myself away from this place"
I said, "Yep, what a concept
I could use a little fuel myself
And we could all use a little change"
Well, the years start coming and they don't stop coming
Fed to the rules and I hit the ground running
Didn't make sense not to live for fun
Your brain gets smart but your head gets dumb
So much to do, so much to see
So what's wrong with taking the backstreets?
You'll never know if you don't go (go!)
You'll never shine if you don't glow
Hey now, you're an all star
Get your game on, go play
Hey now, you're a rock star
Get the show on, get paid
And all that glitters is gold
Only shooting stars break the mold
Hey now
Hey now
Hey, hey, hey now
Hey now
Hey now, you're an all star
Hey now, you're an all star
Hey now, you're an all star
Only shooting stars break the mold
attributes.title: AWFUL APP

attributes.review:
Immediately, when I first opened the app, a giant hologram of the annoying orange sprung out of my phone and came to life. It was absofruitly terrifying. I hid underneath the covers of my blankets as I watched the terrifying being rummage through my room. Seconds later, the creature discovered one of my most prized possessions— my collection of various cartoon stamps. 

Only then, when I was about to give up, I realized that I had little to lose. In a moment of boldness, I grabbed the only things left that were important to me—my coin scrapbook and my phone. I burst out of my room and ran outside the house. 

However, it was too late. The orange had already grown bigger and bigger until it began to eat pieces out of my entire house (only making it stronger). In a flash, I tried to delete the app, but I couldn’t. It was almost like the energy of the orange was to powerful. Reluctantly, but for the safety of myself and the people around me, I made a decision. 

In a flash, I threw my phone onto the ground and stepped on it. I realized quickly that what I had done had weakened the orange, but hadn’t taken it down as I’d wished. On the other hand, I later learned by destroying my phone I was able to vanquish the orange’s invincibility. Now, I had a chance. 

I needed to come up with a strategy, so I decided that I had to find my way to the roof, and I needed a weapon. As I considered this, my phone began to glitch, and exploded into a sea of colors. My pet bee (who had managed to escape the house before me through the window), flew into to mass. I screamed in protest, but he had already flown into the mass. Luckily for me, the curse of the app backfired due to me destroying my phone and turned him into a massive version of himself.

“Barry! You’re okay! Is that really you?” I asked in a haze, perplexed by the majestic beast that flew before me. 

“You must always bee-lieve in yourself.” He advised wisely, before he continued, sparkles showing through his beady little eyes. 

“How am I going to get up there?” I questioned, finding it hard to envision myself taking down this monster.

“Hop onto my back, I’ll fly you up there. Take this.” Barry announced, grabbing a zester in the rubble with his enlarged arm and tossing into the mass where he became bigger. Quickly, I grabbed the giant zester from his arm and hopped onto his back. 

In a frenzy, Barry charged towards the giant orange that was now reaching for one of my neighbors on their balcony.

“No!” I screamed, hopping onto the top of its round body and shredding away pieces of its head. 

The orange yodeled in pain and shock as I continued to shred away at its body. As it’s juices began to leak out, it fell to the floor of my backyard. However, even though it was almost taken down, it still had some strength left and trapped me under the rubble. I felt like I was going to lose and screamed in desperation. 

To my luck, Barry swerved around the orange, avoiding all of its kicks with it’s muscular feet. Deciding it was the only way, he sheathed his stinger and slayed the orange with one final blow. 

In the end, I was able to save my town; however, the damage had already been done. When the orange perished, it began to flood the whole town with a sea of orange juice that took days of repair. My house was already half eaten, a huge chunk of the roof was gone. Most sadly of all, Barry, my pet and only hope had sacrificed himself to protect me and the rest of the town from the evil orange.

The End.
attributes.title: A Magnificent Tale of Tragedy and Zesty Havoc (100% TRUE STORY)
